docs.lead_paragraph: Six months into the biggest-ever Ebola outbreak, scientists say they know more about how the deadly virus behaves. The first cases were reported in Guinea by the World Health Organization on March 23 — before spreading to Sierra Leone, Liberia and elsewhere. Here's a look at what scientists have learned so far.

headline.main: Lessons Learned 6 Months Into Worst Ebola Outbreak
headline.print_headline: Lessons Learned 6 Months Into Worst Ebola Outbreak

docs.snippet: Six months into the biggest-ever Ebola outbreak, scientists say they know more about how the deadly virus behaves. The first cases were reported in Guinea by the World Health Organization on March 23 — before spreading to Sierra Leone, Liberia...

docs.lead_paragraph: New figures from the World Health Organization suggest that the Ebola virus could become a constant presence in West Africa and cause more than 20,000 cases by Nov. 2.

headline.main: Health Agency’s New Assessment of Epidemic Is More Dire Still
headline.print_headline: Health Agency’s New Assessment of the Epidemic Is More Dire Still

docs.abstract: World Health Organization publishes figures in New England Journal of Medicine that reveal far worse outlook than it had previously anticipated for Ebola epidemic in West Africa; report raises for first time possibility that epidemic will not be brought under control and that the disease will become endemic in the region.
docs.snippet: New figures from the World Health Organization suggest that the Ebola virus could become a constant presence in West Africa and cause more than 20,000 cases by Nov. 2.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. health officials Tuesday laid out worst-case and best-case scenarios for the Ebola epidemic in West Africa, warning that the number of infected people could explode to at least 1.4 million by mid-January — or peak well below that, if efforts to control the outbreak are ramped up.

headline.main: US Warns That Ebola Could Infect 1.4 Million
headline.print_headline: US Warns That Ebola Could Infect 1.4 Million
